tit.j: ヒメタタライスズヒメ

sen.j: ヒメタタライスズヒメは、神武天皇の皇后である。
sen.e: Himetataraisuzuhime was Empress of Emperor Jinmu.
Himetataraisuzuhime was the empress of Emperor Jinmu.
Himetataraisuzuhime was the empress of Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 神武天皇は、東征以前の日向国ですでに吾平津姫を娶り子供も二人いたが、大和征服後、在地の豪族の娘を正妃とすることで、在地豪族を懐柔しようとした。
sen.e: Emperor Jinmu had already married Ahiratsuhime and had two children in Hyuga province before his Tosei (Eastern Expedition); however, after conquering the Yamato region, he sought to win over the local ruling families by marrying a daughter of them as his legitimate empress.

Emperor Jinmu had already married Ahiratsuhime and had two children in Hyuga Province before his Tosei (eastern expedition); however, after conquering the Yamato region he sought to win over the local ruling families by marrying one of their daughters as his legitimate empress.

Emperor Jinmu had already married Ahiratsuhime and had two children in Hyuga Province before his Tosei (eastern expedition); however, after conquering the Yamato region he sought to win over the local ruling families by marrying one of their daughters as his legitimate empress.

sen.j: 天照大神の子孫である神武天皇とヒメタタライスズヒメが結婚することで、天津神系と国津神系に分かれた系譜がまた1つに統合されることになる。
sen.e: The Marriage between Emperor Jinmu, a descendant of Amaterasu Omikami (the Great Sun Goddess, head of all heavenly kami (kami: deity)), and Himetataraisuzuhime would reunite branched genealogies of the line of heavenly kami and the line of earthly kami.

The marriage between Emperor Jinmu, a descendant of Amaterasu Omikami (the great sun goddess and head of all heavenly kami (kami: deity)), and Himetataraisuzuhime would reunite the branched genealogies of the line of heavenly kami and the line of earthly kami.

The marriage between Emperor Jinmu, a descendant of Amaterasu Omikami (the great sun goddess and head of all heavenly kami (kami: deity)), and Himetataraisuzuhime would reunite the branched genealogies of the line of heavenly kami and the line of earthly kami.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』では「媛蹈鞴五十鈴媛命」と記す。
sen.e: Himetataraisuzuhime was written as '媛蹈鞴五十鈴媛命' in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
Himetataraisuzuhime was written as '媛蹈鞴五十鈴媛命' in "Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan").
Himetataraisuzuhime was written as '媛蹈鞴五十鈴媛命' in "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 『古事記』では「比売多多良伊須気余理比売」（ヒメタタライスケヨリヒメ）と記し、別名、「富登多多良伊須岐比売」（ホトタタライスキヒメ）としている。
sen.e: Himetataraisuzuhime was written as '比売多多良伊須気余理比売' (pronounced Himetataraisukeyorihime) and '富登多多良伊須岐比売 ' (pronounced Hototataraisukihime) as another name in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
Himetataraisuzuhime was written as '比売多多良伊須気余理比売' (pronounced Himetataraisukeyorihime) and '富登多多良伊須岐比売 ' (pronounced Hototataraisukihime) as another name in "Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters").
Himetataraisuzuhime was written as '比売多多良伊須気余理比売' (pronounced Himetataraisukeyorihime) and '富登多多良伊須岐比売' (pronounced Hototataraisukihime) as another name in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
sen.cmt: スペース削除"の位置移動

sen.j: 皇后の名の中にある「タタラ」とは、たたら吹き製鉄の時に用いられる道具であり、このことは、皇后の出身氏族が、製鉄と深い関係があったことを物語っていると考えられている。
sen.e: As 'Tatara' in the names of Empress was a device used in tatarabuki ironmaking (method of making iron by using tatara (bellows)), it is considered that the clan in which Empress was born was involved in ironmaking.

As 'Tatara' in the name of the empress was a device used in tatarabuki iron-making (a method of making iron by using a tatara (bellows)), it is considered that the clan in which the empress was born was involved in iron-making.

It is considered that the empress was from a clan which was involved in iron-making because 'Tatara' in the name of the empress was a device used in tatarabuki iron-making (a method of making iron by using a tatara (bellows)).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 『古事記』では、大物主（スサノオの子孫大国主の和魂とされる）と勢夜陀多良比売（セヤダタラヒメ）の娘である。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki", Himetataraisuzuhime was a daughter of the Omononushi (considered as a calm tutelary deity of Okuninushi (great land master) who was a descendant of Susano-O (the Storm Deity)) and Seyadatarahime.

According to "Kojiki," Himetataraisuzuhime was a daughter of the Omononushi (considered as a calm tutelary deity of Okuninushi (great land master), who was a descendant of Susano-O (the storm deity)) and Seyadatarahime.

According to the "Kojiki," Himetataraisuzuhime was a daughter of the Omononushi (considered as the calm spirit of Okuninushi (great land master), who was a descendant of Susano-O (the storm deity)) and Seyadatarahime.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 勢夜陀多良比売が美人であるという噂を耳にした大物主は、彼女に一目惚れした。
sen.e: Having heard a Seyadatarahime's reputation for her beauty, Omononushi fell in love with her at first sight.
Omononushi, having heard of Seyadatarahime's reputation as a great beauty, fell in love with her at first sight.
Omononushi, having heard of Seyadatarahime's reputation as a great beauty, fell in love with her at first sight.

sen.j: 大物主は赤い矢に姿を変え、勢夜陀多良比売が用を足しに来る頃を見計らって川の上流から流れて行き、彼女の下を流れていくときに、ほと（陰所）を突いた。
sen.e: Omononushi transformed himself into a red arrow, and at the right time for coming across Seyadatarahime who came to a stream to relieve herself, he floated down the stream and, as he flowed just below her, struck her in hoto (the genitals).

Omononushi transformed himself into a red arrow, and at the right time in which to encounter Seyadatarahime, who had come to a stream to relieve herself, he floated down the stream and, as he flowed just below her, struck her in the hoto (genitals).
Omononushi transformed himself into a red arrow and floated downstream to strike Seyadatarahime in the hoto (genitals) just as she came to the stream to relieve herself.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 彼女がその矢を自分の部屋に持ち帰ると大物主は元の姿に戻り、二人は結ばれた。
sen.e: When she took the arrow to her room, the arrow turned back into Omononushi and marry her.
When she took the arrow to her room, the arrow turned back into Omononushi and he married her.
When she took the arrow to her room, the arrow turned back into Omononushi and he married her.

sen.j: こうして生れた子がヒメタタライスズヒメである。
sen.e: A baby born to the couple in due course was Himetataraisuzuhime that was to be.
A baby born to the couple in due course was Himetataraisuzuhime, which was destiny.
A baby born to the couple in due course was Himetataraisuzuhime.

sen.j: ホトを突かれてびっくりして生まれた子であるということでホトタタライスキヒメと名づけ、後に「ホト」を嫌ってヒメタタライスケヨリヒメに名を変えた。
sen.e: The baby was named Hototataraisukihime because its mother became pregnant with the baby as a result of being struck in hoto and got startled; however, Hototataraisukihime renamed to Himetataraisuzuhime, minding Hoto in the original name.

The baby was called Hototataraisukihime because its mother had become pregnant with the baby as a result of being struck in the hoto and becoming startled; however, Hototataraisukihime was renamed to Himetataraisuzuhime, with the awareness of "Hoto" in the original name.

The baby was called Hototataraisukihime since her mother had become pregnant with the baby as a result of being startled by being struck in the hoto; however, Hototataraisukihime was renamed to Himetataraisukeyorihime to eliminate "Hoto" from the original name.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.j: 日本書紀第6の一書・事代主神

sen.j: 『日本書紀』第6の一書では「事代主神化爲八尋熊鰐 通三嶋溝樴姫 或云 玉櫛姫 而生兒 姫蹈鞴五十鈴姫命 是爲神日本磐余彦火火出見天皇之后也」とあり事代主神が八尋鰐と化し三嶋溝樴姫あるいは玉櫛姫のもとに通い、媛蹈鞴五十鈴媛命が生まれたという記述がある。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" Volume 6 Number 1 includes the description of '事代主神化爲八尋熊鰐 通三嶋溝樴姫 或云 玉櫛姫 而生兒 姫蹈鞴五十鈴姫命 是爲神日本磐余彦火火出見天皇之后也' which means that Kotoshironushinokami transformed himself into Yahirowani (eight-fathom shark) and paid frequent visits to Mishimanomizokuhihime, also known as Tamakushihime, and Himetataraisuzuhime was born to the couple.

"Nihon Shoki" Volume 6 Number 1 includes the description of '事代主神化爲八尋熊鰐 通三嶋溝樴姫 或云 玉櫛姫 而生兒 姫蹈鞴五十鈴姫命 是爲神日本磐余彦火火出見天皇之后也,' which means that Kotoshironushinokami had transformed himself into Yahirowani (eight-fathom shark) and paid frequent visits to Mishimanomizokuhihime, also known as Tamakushihime, and that Himetataraisuzuhime was born to the couple.

"Nihon Shoki" Volume 6 Number 1 includes the description of '事代主神化爲八尋熊鰐 通三嶋溝樴姫 或云 玉櫛姫 而生兒 姫蹈鞴五十鈴姫命 是爲神日本磐余彦火火出見天皇之后也,' which means that Kotoshironushinokami had transformed himself into Yahirowani (eight-fathom shark) and paid frequent visits to Mishimanomizokuhihime, also known as Tamakushihime, and that Himetataraisuzuhime was born to the couple.

sen.j: なお『先代旧事本紀』巻4地祇本紀にも「都味齒八重事代主神 化八尋熊鰐 通三島溝杭女 活玉依姬 生一男一女（中略）妹 踏韛五十鈴姬命 此命 橿原原朝立為皇后 誕生二兒 即 神渟名耳天皇 綏靖 次產 八井耳命是也」と同様記述がある。
sen.e: Also "Sendai Kuji Hongi" (The Fundamental Records of the Ancient Matters of Former Ages) Volume 4 Chigi Hongi includes the description of '都味齒八重事代主神 化八尋熊鰐 通三島溝杭女 活玉依姬 生一男一女(中略)妹 踏韛五十鈴姬命 此命 橿原原朝立為皇后 誕生二兒 即 神渟名耳天皇 綏靖 次產 八井耳命是也' which means the same as the above description.

Also "Sendai Kuji Hongi" (The Fundamental Records of the Ancient Matters of Former Ages) Volume 4 Chigi Hongi includes the description of '都味齒八重事代主神 化八尋熊鰐 通三島溝杭女 活玉依姬 生一男一女(中略)妹 踏韛五十鈴姬命 此命 橿原原朝立為皇后 誕生二兒 即 神渟名耳天皇 綏靖 次產 八井耳命是也,' which means the same as the above description.

Also "Sendai Kuji Hongi" (The Fundamental Records of the Ancient Matters of Former Ages) Volume 4 Chigi Hongi includes the description of '都味齒八重事代主神 化八尋熊鰐 通三島溝杭女 活玉依姫 生一男一女(中略)妹 踏{韋備-イ}五十鈴姫命 此命 橿原原朝立為皇后 誕生二兒 即 神渟名耳天皇 綏靖 次産 八井耳命是也,' which is equivalent to the description in Nihon Shoki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 神武天皇との子は、上から順に、ヒコヤイノミコト、カンヤイミミノミコト、綏靖天皇である。
sen.e: Emperor Jinmu and Himetataraisuzuhime had children Hikoyainomikoto, Kanyaimiminomikoto, and Emperor Suizei in the order of birth dates.
Emperor Jinmu and Himetataraisuzuhime had children Hikoyainomikoto, Kanyaimiminomikoto and Emperor Suizei, in the order of birth dates.
Emperor Jinmu and Himetataraisuzuhime had children in the order of: Hikoyainomikoto, Kanyaimiminomikoto and Emperor Suizei.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 神武天皇の死後、神武天皇の子である手研耳命（タギシミミ）と結婚するも、タギシミミの反逆において子供たちに夫の謀意について知らせて反逆を防いだ。
sen.e: After Emperor Jinmu died, Himetataraisuzuhime married Tagishimimi who was a son of Emperor Jinmu; though, she prevented a rebellion plotted by her husband by notifying her children of her husband's political intrigue.

After Emperor Jinmu died, Himetataraisuzuhime married Tagishimimi, who was a son of Emperor Jinmu; however she prevented the rebellion plotted by her husband by notifying her children of her husband's political intrigue.

After Emperor Jinmu died, Himetataraisuzuhime married Tagishimimi, who was a son of Emperor Jinmu and she prevented the rebellion plotted by her husband by notifying her children of her husband's political intrigue.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
